alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Kanawha; Lewis; Ritchie; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:05PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Calhoun, southeastern Ritchie, Doddridge, northeastern Kanawha, Gilmer, northwestern Lewis, northwestern Braxton, southeastern Roane, north central Clay and southwestern Harrison Counties through 430 PM EST... At 404 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spencer, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Weston, Glenville, Grantsville, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Gassaway, West Union, Anmoore, Jackson Mill, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Big Otter, Wallback, Amma, West Milford, Burnsville, Sand Fork and Pullman. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 12 and 52, and between mile markers 75 and 86, and near mile marker 94. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 46 and 75. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
